statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Sean Hoehn scored 22 points, Cameron Parker posted his first career double-double with 12 points and 10 assists and Sacred Heart defeated Hartford 98-89 Tuesday night, halting a three-game skid.
article.headline: Hoehn sparks balanced Sacred Heart past Hartford 98-89
article.linkText: Hoehn sparks balanced Sacred Heart past Hartford 98-89
article.story: FAIRFIELD, Conn. -- Sean Hoehn scored 22 points, Cameron Parker posted his first career double-double with 12 points and 10 assists and Sacred Heart defeated Hartford 98-89 Tuesday night, halting a three-game skid. The Pioneers shot 59 percent from the floor, making 34 of 58 shots with six players scoring in double figures. Jare'L Spellman added 15 points with three blocked shots, Kinnon LaRose scored 14 with nine rebounds, Aaron Clarke had 11 points with four assists and Zach Pfaffenberger scored 10. The Pioneers (3-4) broke away midway through the first half when Hoehn scored on a drive to spark a 13-2 run. Hartford (2-6) closed to 49-44 early in the second half and stayed within a few baskets until the Pioneers pulled away late in the game. John Carroll led the Hawks with 26 points, Jason Dunne added 25 and JR Lynch 19. Thirteen of Hartford's 27 made baskets were 3-pointers.
